ai_explanation:
The system applies a single decision rule that scores each candidate destination by combining the user’s priorities (i.e., relaxation and travel convenience) into one compact formula:

Score(destination) = 0.90 × (relaxation_rating) + 0.10 × max(0, (7 hours – travel_time) / 7 hours)

How the decision was taken:

  • It estimates each destination’s relaxation rating (on a 0–1 scale) and its travel time from Germany.
  • It computes the convenience term using 8.5 hours of travel_time, floored at 0 if it exceeds 7 hours.
  • It multiplies relaxation_rating by 0.9 and the convenience term by 0.1, then sums them.
  • Finally, it selects the destination with the highest score.

Why the decision was taken:

  • Sharm El Sheikh has relaxation_rating ≈ 0.98 but travel_time ≈ 8.5 h → convenience = 0.
  • So, 0.9 × 0.98 + 0.1 × 0 = 0.882.
  • Alternatives like Azores or Zanzibar (relaxation ~0.9, travel ~7–12 h) score only ≈ 0.76.
